name: op1sta

body.origin:
|- wceq(cuni(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), c0)
-| wceq(cuni(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), cuni(csn(c0)))
-| wceq(cuni(csn(c0)), c0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cuni(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), c0)
-| wceq(cuni(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), cuni(csn(c0)))
-| wceq(cuni(csn(c0)), c0)

body.origin:
|- wceq(cuni(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), cuni(csn(c0)))
-| wceq(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1))), csn(c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(cuni(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), c0)
-| wceq(cuni(csn(c0)), c0)
-| wceq(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1))), csn(c0))

|- wceq(cuni(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), c0)
-| wceq(cuni(csn(c0)), c0)
-| wcel(c1, universe)

|- wceq(cuni(cdm(csn(cop(c0, c1)))), c0)
-| wcel(c1, universe)
-| wcel(c0, universe)

comment: Extract the first member of an ordered pair. (See ~ op2nda to extract the second member, ~ op1stb for an alternate version, and ~ op1st for the preferred version.) (Contributed by Raph Levien, 4-Dec-2003.)
